comments.body: This needs a guard, since `self.iam_role` will be unset if the option isn't specified.
It seemed more in line with the rest of the code to define the variable with a default value in `read_settings`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +556,560 @@            self.boto_fix_security_token_in_profile(connect_args)

        if self.iam_role:
            sts_conn = sts.connect_to_region(region, **connect_args)
            role = sts_conn.assume_role(self.iam_role, 'ansible_dynamic_inventory')

comments.body: use elif, its a minor optimization but will avoid overwriting errors. Same below.

comments.body: Thanks for your work on this! It works as expected (although I wish describe_db_instances() could filter by tags as it would be simpler not to filter out the results while retrieving them).
Agreed. It doesn't appear the RDS API supports that yet :(

Looks good to me!

This is working as expected.

A couple minor things I noticed:
* Using STS credentials doesn't work with dynamic inventory (it doesn't work on devel either).
* I'm also wondering about this bit. I'm reading the removed lines 459-462 as 'if this group_by_thing doesn't have the option provided it defaults to true' - if the file doesn't exist then it seems like the behavior is changing a little. (such as, group_by_aws_account is false by default in the ini but if it isn't provided it defaults to true here; now it defaults to false always). I think that's okay though.

I transfered the defaults in the `ini` file to the `DEFAULTS` variable. The two `group_by` options that are `False` in the `ini` file are false in `DEFAULTS`. All other `group_by` options are `True`.

See lines [174](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/28375/files#diff-c2e371537339bbab5d9d0cc5d6cb7adcR174) and [180](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/28375/files#diff-c2e371537339bbab5d9d0cc5d6cb7adcR180).

Yeah, I see that you kept the behavior specified by default in the ini. I just meant that before, if the group_by option was not provided those by-default Falses would default-default to True by omission (as opposed to now, when it is always False by omission) on the deleted line 462. Just a weird corner case.

Oh, I had not connected those dots. I suppose that begs the question "What should the default be?". Hopefully sticking with what was defined in the `ini` file will be ok. I think that was effectively the default anyway since the script before would not run without an `ini` file.

Thanks for the feedback.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +451,455 @@        group_by_options = [a for a in DEFAULTS if a.startswith('group_by')]
        for option in group_by_options:
            setattr(self, option, config.getboolean('ec2', option))

        # Do we need to just include hosts that match a pattern?
